title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of CaCO3
text: Use the equation Moles of Reactant A $$=$$ Mass of Reactant A * (Moles of Reactant A)/(Molar Mass of Reactant A).

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of CaCO3
text: What is $$(1.31$$ g CaCO3)*(1 mol CaCO3 / $$100.09$$ g CaCO3)? Keep three decimal places.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$1$$ mol CO2 / $$1$$ mol CaCO3.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of CO2
text: The molar amount of CO2 is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of CaCO3 by multiplying the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of CO2
text: What is $$(0.013$$ mol CO2)*(1 mol CO2 / $$1$$ mol CaCO_3)? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Mass of CO2
text: Calculate the Mass of CO2 with Mass of Reactant A $$=$$ (Molar Mass of Reactant A)/(Moles of Reactant A)*Moles of Reactant A)

title: Calculate the Mass of CO2
text: What is $$(0.013$$ mol CO2)*(44.01 g CO2)/(mol CO2)? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: Calculate the percentage yield with $$___$$ % yield $$=$$ (Experimental (actual) yield of product C)/(Theoretical (calculated) yield of product C)*100.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: What is $$0.53$$ g $$CO_2$$ /0.572 g $$CO_2$$? Give your answer as an integer.
